SEARCH

Package com.github.timmy80.mia.core

package com.github.timmy80.mia.core
  • Class
    Description
    ApplicationContext
    A common context for multiple Task
    Ex : A call on ApplicationContext.stop() will perform a stop on all the Task of this context.
    ApplicationContextParams
    Parameters of an ApplicationContext
    Async
    Utility class to manage calls to FunctionalInterface by an Executor with support for timeouts(See: TimeLimit).
    This class offers FunctionalInterfaces for Void and NonVoid functions up to 4 arguments.

    You have access to a variety of methods named with the following principles:
    starts with run for void returning methods and call for non void methods. ends with Before when the execution is time constrained and Later otherwise. When the execution time is constrained in case of a timeout the CompletableFuture will be completed exceptionally by a TimeLimitExceededException

    Examples:
    Async.Function1<R,T0>
    A Function that supports Exception
    Async.Function2<R,T0,T1>
    A Function that supports Exception and 2 args
    Async.Function3<R,T0,T1,T2>
    A Function that supports Exception and 3 args
    Async.Function4<R,T0,T1,T2,T3>
    A Function that supports Exception and 4 args
    Async.ThrowingRunnable
    A Runnable that supports Exception
    Async.VoidFunction1<T0>
    A void returning Function that supports Exception
    Async.VoidFunction2<T0,T1>
    A void returning Function that supports Exception and 2 args
    Async.VoidFunction3<T0,T1,T2>
    A void returning Function that supports Exception and 3 args
    Async.VoidFunction4<T0,T1,T2,T3>
    A void returning Function that supports Exception and 4 args
    DefaultLivenessProbe
    The default liveness probe handler.
    Simply check that no Task is hung for more than 20seconds.
    Completes with status 200 OK if all the tasks are OK.
    DefaultReadinessProbe
    The default readiness probe handler.
    Simply check that all Task are alive and not hung for more than 20seconds.
    Completes with status 200 OK if all the tasks are OK and the ApplicationContext is not stop pending.
    EventControlBlock
    A simple event synchronization block.
    ExecutionStage
    A MiA execution stage.
    InactiveStateException
    Exception thrown when a job is not executed because the state that requested the call is inactive.
    InitialState
    Initial dumb State which is used as the default state of Terminal on terminal creation.
    LogFmt
    A utility class to create log messages using the Logfmt format.
    Get more info at https://brandur.org/logfmt
    ProbeHandlerTerm
    Base class for a liveness, readiness, ... probe request handling
    ProbeHttpServerHandler
    A Netty handler for the Probetask
    ProbesTask
    A task that manages the probes configured on its ApplicationContext
    State
    A very simple base class to create States for Terminal.
    Task
    A MiA task.
    Terminal<T extends Task>
    A non Thread Executor which depends on a Task to be executed.
    Creating terminals allows to dispatch the management of complex sub-tasks in a logical context.
    Terminal provides a state mechanism which allows to further dispatch the complexity.

    A Terminal has always a State unless terminated.
    TerminalState
    Base class of a Terminal State
    TerminatedTerminalException
    Exception class thrown when an execution is attempted on an inactive Terminal
    TimeLimit
    A simple expression of a time limit used for real time applications.
    A TimeLimit less or equal to 0 means no limit.
    TimeLimitExceededException
    Exception thrown if the TimeLimit given to a call to Async.callBefore(java.util.concurrent.Executor, com.github.timmy80.mia.core.TimeLimit, java.util.concurrent.Callable<R>) or Async.runBefore(java.util.concurrent.Executor, com.github.timmy80.mia.core.TimeLimit, com.github.timmy80.mia.core.Async.ThrowingRunnable) is exceeded before or during execution.
    TimerTask
    Extend TimerTask to make it a FunctionalInterface
